result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge and his supervision fees from CASH BAIL ON DEPOST, if any remaining balance is due, it should be paid from 25% of his prison wages, remainder, if any, to be paid during his period of extended supervision.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin statutes.

superMiscConds.notes: - Successfully complete any counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes:
No contact with firearms. 
Court advises defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample. Defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (25 pages) commencing MARCH 3, 2016 received and filed. kl
Bail refund
3/9/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Dominic A Brown in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Dominic A Brown in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements as to sentencing by state and defense.  Additional statement/s by:  Elizabeth C.
As to count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 155 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 32 months and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 40 months with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge and his 
        supervision fees from bail on deposit, if any remaining balance is due, it should be paid from 25% of his prison wages, remainder, if any,  to be paid during his period of extended supervision.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
         Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment signed by the defendant and filed.  
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs, pursuant to 973.047 of Wisconsin 
        statutes.
.
As to count 5:

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 8 months at the House of Correction with 155 days credit, concurrent with count 1.
  
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge and the DV surcharge as to count 2 to be paid from bail on deposit.  If there is a balance, the remainder should be taken from 25% of his prison wages,  remainder during his period of ES, any remaining balance will result in a civil judgment.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.



The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, credit form, ineligible voting rights form.

As to counts 1 and 5:
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to counts 2, 3 and 4:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Court modified bail to $10,000.00 cash.  Defendant to be turned over to Jusice Point if bail is posted as previously ordered.
 Court has no objection to the defendant being sent back to Waukesha County Jail until the sentencing date.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominic A Brown in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Milwaukee Police Department Tetz Laff. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #03CF6685 that are attached to the complaint. Defense counsel withdrew as counsel, defendant will retain private counsel. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Elizabeth C. or her children. Branden T. or Jernise C. (a citizen witness).
